name: Dark Alakazam

attacks.name: Teleport Blast
attacks.text: You may switch Dark Alakazam with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

flavorText: Almost as if it were being controlled by something else, it never changes expressions, even in the middle of battle.

strengths: Mind Shock bypasses Weakness and Resistance for consistent damage
Can retreat to safety after attacking
weaknesses: Low HP of 60 for a Stage 2 Pokemon
High retreat cost of 3 if you can't switch
Psychic weakness is common in the format

competitiveHistory: Dark Alakazam saw limited competitive play due to its low HP for a Stage 2 Pokemon. The hit-and-run capability with Teleport Blast was interesting but the 60 HP made it fragile. Mind Shock's ability to bypass Weakness and Resistance was useful but not enough to make it a top-tier threat. This non-holo version is functionally identical to the holo version.

rulings.ruling: Teleport Blast's switching effect is optional - you may choose not to switch.
Mind Shock still triggers effects that occur 'when damaged' even though Weakness and Resistance don't apply.
You must have a Benched Pokemon to switch with if you choose to use Teleport Blast's effect.
